oai_dc:dc.dc:title: It may be far to Tipperary it's a longer way to Tennessee, 1914
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Based on the English Music Hall song, "It's A Long Way To Tipperary" (1912, by Harry Williams and Jack Judge) which became a favorite and famous marching song of the British Expeditionary Force at the very outbreak of World War I in August, 1914, this Tin Pan Alley takeoff by lyricist Arthur J. Lamb and composer Alfred Solman was written in those first months of war (1914) and features a soldier with a sweetheart not from Tipperary (Ireland) but rather from Tennessee, already famous as the Volunteer State. Forms part of the Kenneth A. Kanter American Music and Theatre Collection. 1 sheet music publication (5 p.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Arts; Music; Military History; World War I; World War, 1914-1918--Songs and music; Popular music--1911-1920
Tipperary (Ireland)--Songs and music; Tennessee--Songs and music
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Solman, Alfred, 1868-1937 (Composer)
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219.
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Lamb, Arthur J. (Lyricist); Joe Morris Music Co. (Publisher)
oai_dc:dc.dc:type: Text; Sheet music covers; Scores, music
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: KAKC-It May Be Far to Tipperary-TN
